traps.name: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat
Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

traps.name: Elevated Pike Shoulder Shrug
steps: Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

traps.name: Dumbbell Seated Shrug
steps: Sit on a bench with dumbbells in both hands, palms facing your body, back straight.
Elevate your shoulders and hold the contracted position at the apex of the motion.
Slowly lower your shoulders back to starting position.
Stand tall with two dumbbells. Pull your shoulder blades up. Give a one second squeeze at the top.
Lay sideways on a bench letting your arm hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blade and joint toward the ceiling.
Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

traps.name: Dumbbell Shrug
steps: Stand tall with two dumbbells. Pull your shoulder blades up. Give a one second squeeze at the top.
Lay sideways on a bench letting your arm hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blade and joint toward the ceiling.
Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

traps.name: Dumbbell Laying 30 Degree Shrug
steps: Lay sideways on a bench letting your arm hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blade and joint toward the ceiling.
Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

traps.name: Dumbbell Laying Silverback Shrug
steps: Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

traps.name: Barbell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the Barbell with both hands in front just past shoulder width.
Bend forward at the hips with a slight bend in your knees, keeping your back straight.
Engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug.
Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.
Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell in front of you.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Once the barbell is at your hips, raise your shoulders as high as you can, holding the position for a moment.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

traps.name: Barbell Upright Row
steps: Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.
Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell in front of you.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Once the barbell is at your hips, raise your shoulders as high as you can, holding the position for a moment.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

traps.name: Barbell Shrug
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell in front of you.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Once the barbell is at your hips, raise your shoulders as high as you can, holding the position for a moment.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

traps.name: Barbell Z Press
steps: Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

traps.name: Traps Stretch Variation One
steps: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Place your left hand on your head and gently pull your head down towards your left shoulder. Then return to centre point.
Repeat, using your right hand pulling towards your right shoulder.
Keeping your chest facing forward, turn your head 90 degrees to the left. Then return to centre point.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Repeat, turning your head in the other direction.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Nod your head forward, bringing your chin to your chest.
You will feel the stretch across your neck.

traps.name: Traps Stretch Variation Two
steps: Keeping your chest facing forward, turn your head 90 degrees to the left. Then return to centre point.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Repeat, turning your head in the other direction.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Nod your head forward, bringing your chin to your chest.
You will feel the stretch across your neck.

traps.name: Traps Stretch Variation Three
steps: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Nod your head forward, bringing your chin to your chest.
You will feel the stretch across your neck.

traps.name: Kettlebell Incline Shrug
steps: Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug and repeat

traps.name: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug and repeat

traps.name: Kettlebell Upright Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug and repeat

traps.name: Kettlebell Shrug
steps: Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug and repeat

traps.name: Band Shrug
steps: Place the band under your feet. Stand upright.
Elevate your shoulder blades and then depress back to the starting position.
Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.
Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

traps.name: Band Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.
Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

traps.name: Band Horizontal Shrug
steps: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

traps.name: Cable Silverback Shrug
steps: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.
Stand up with the attachment in hand, walk a couple of steps back make sure you are standing upright and not leaning backwards.
Retract your shoulder blades and then protract to return to the starting position.
Use a handle attachment on both sides of crossover. With cable attachment set all the way to the bottom.
Grab both handles and make sure you are centered in the machine. Let your arms hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blades up and in towards your ears. Let your shoulder blades depress back to the starting position.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

traps.name: Cable 30 Degree Shrug
steps: Use a handle attachment on both sides of crossover. With cable attachment set all the way to the bottom.
Grab both handles and make sure you are centered in the machine. Let your arms hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blades up and in towards your ears. Let your shoulder blades depress back to the starting position.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

traps.name: Cable Upright Row
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

traps_middle.name: Pull Ups
steps: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
Lower your body back to starting position.
Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat
Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull your body straight up to the bar.
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

traps_middle.name: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat
Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull your body straight up to the bar.
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

traps_middle.name: Inverted Row
steps: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull your body straight up to the bar.
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

traps_middle.name: Dumbbell Row Bilateral
steps: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.
The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.
Let your arms hang freely, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.
Brace your off arm against something stable (bench, box). Stagger your stance so your leg on the side of your working arm is back.
Try to get your torso to parallel with the ground. That will extend your range of motion.
Let your arm hang freely and then pull your elbow back. Imagine you've got a tennis ball in your armpit and squeeze it each rep.
Hinge forward slightly at the hips. Make sure to keep a flat back. Let your arms hang in front of you.
Let your scapula protract, and then retract them. Imagine you have a pencil in your mid-back and squeeze it between your shoulder blades.
Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

traps_middle.name: Dumbbell Row Unilateral
steps: Brace your off arm against something stable (bench, box). Stagger your stance so your leg on the side of your working arm is back.
Try to get your torso to parallel with the ground. That will extend your range of motion.
Let your arm hang freely and then pull your elbow back. Imagine you've got a tennis ball in your armpit and squeeze it each rep.
Hinge forward slightly at the hips. Make sure to keep a flat back. Let your arms hang in front of you.
Let your scapula protract, and then retract them. Imagine you have a pencil in your mid-back and squeeze it between your shoulder blades.
Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

traps_middle.name: Dumbbell Silverback Shrug
steps: Hinge forward slightly at the hips. Make sure to keep a flat back. Let your arms hang in front of you.
Let your scapula protract, and then retract them. Imagine you have a pencil in your mid-back and squeeze it between your shoulder blades.
Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

traps_middle.name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
steps: Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

traps_middle.name: Barbell Deadlift
steps: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.
Stand to your full height and hold.
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

traps_middle.name: Barbell Landmine Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

traps_middle.name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation One
steps: Repeat with your other arm.

Stand up with your feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top.
Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back.
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.
Switch sides and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation Two
steps: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top.
Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back.
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.
Switch sides and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Kettlebell Incline Shrug
steps: Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Return to standing position and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Return to standing position and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Kettlebell Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Return to standing position and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Return to standing position and repeat.

traps_middle.name: Band Pull Apart
steps: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you.
Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.
Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.
Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.
Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

traps_middle.name: Band Horizontal Shrug
steps: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.
Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.
Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

traps_middle.name: Band High Face Pull
steps: Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.
Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

traps_middle.name: Band Rear Delt Fly
steps: Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

traps_middle.name: Cable Silverback Shrug
steps: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.
Stand up with the attachment in hand, walk a couple of steps back make sure you are standing upright and not leaning backwards.
Retract your shoulder blades and then protract to return to the starting position.

shoulders.name: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat
Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

shoulders.name: Elevated Pike Shoulder Shrug
steps: Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Seated Overhead Press
steps: Sit on a bench with back support. Raise the dumbbells to shoulder height with your palms forward.
Raise the dumbbells upwards and pause at the contracted position.
Lower the weights back to starting position.
Stand up straight with dumbbells at either side, palms facing your hips.
Raise your arms on either side with a slight bend in your elbow until they are parallel with the floor. Pause at the top of the motion.
Slowly return your arms down to starting position.
Grab two dumbbells while standing upright with the dumbbells at your side.
Raise the two dumbbells with your elbows being fully extended until the dumbbells are eye level.
Lower the weights in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat.
With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
steps: Stand up straight with dumbbells at either side, palms facing your hips.
Raise your arms on either side with a slight bend in your elbow until they are parallel with the floor. Pause at the top of the motion.
Slowly return your arms down to starting position.
Grab two dumbbells while standing upright with the dumbbells at your side.
Raise the two dumbbells with your elbows being fully extended until the dumbbells are eye level.
Lower the weights in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat.
With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
steps: Grab two dumbbells while standing upright with the dumbbells at your side.
Raise the two dumbbells with your elbows being fully extended until the dumbbells are eye level.
Lower the weights in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat.
With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Seated Rear Delt Fly
steps: With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

shoulders.name: Barbell Overhead Press
steps: Take a roughly shoulder width grip. There should be a straight line from your elbow to fist (vertical forearms).
Pull your chin back and press the weight toward the ceiling by extending at the elbow joint and flexing at the shoulder joint.
Press until your elbows are extended and push your head forward slightly.
Return to the start position with control. Pulling your chin back to allow the bar to pass your face safely.
Stand tall with an overhand grip on the barbell. Raise your arms until your fists are around eye level.
Return to the start under control. This exercise is prone to using momentum when you begin to fatigue.
Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

shoulders.name: Barbell Front Raise
steps: Stand tall with an overhand grip on the barbell. Raise your arms until your fists are around eye level.
Return to the start under control. This exercise is prone to using momentum when you begin to fatigue.
Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

shoulders.name: Barbell Upright Row
steps: Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.
Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

shoulders.name: Barbell Z Press
steps: Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

shoulders.name: Shoulders Stretch Variation One
steps: Reach one arm behind your body, with your elbow pointing upward behind your head.
Assist the stretch with your other hand on your elbow to engage your shoulder.
Pause for a few seconds, then repeat the stretch with your other arm.
Start with your arms at either side. Begin by pushing your shoulders forward and in towards your chest.
Repeat as necessary.
Continue the circular motion with your shoulders, pinching up towards your ears, and then extending your chest outwards while you finish the motion.
Place the top of your hand into the small of your back, your arm at a 90 degree angle.
Hold your elbow with the other arm, and slowly pull the arm forward until you feel your shoulder engaged in the stretch. Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position.
Return to starting position, and repeat with your other arm.

Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Repeat with your other arm.

shoulders.name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Two
steps: Start with your arms at either side. Begin by pushing your shoulders forward and in towards your chest.
Repeat as necessary.
Continue the circular motion with your shoulders, pinching up towards your ears, and then extending your chest outwards while you finish the motion.
Place the top of your hand into the small of your back, your arm at a 90 degree angle.
Hold your elbow with the other arm, and slowly pull the arm forward until you feel your shoulder engaged in the stretch. Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position.
Return to starting position, and repeat with your other arm.

Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Repeat with your other arm.

shoulders.name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Three
steps: Place the top of your hand into the small of your back, your arm at a 90 degree angle.
Hold your elbow with the other arm, and slowly pull the arm forward until you feel your shoulder engaged in the stretch. Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position.
Return to starting position, and repeat with your other arm.

Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Repeat with your other arm.

shoulders.name: Shoulders Stretch Variation Four
steps: Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Repeat with your other arm.

shoulders.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Rear Delt Fly
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Bring one arm behind you and rest this arm on your back. With the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length close to the floor.
Swing the kettlebell out and up towards the side of your body and then return to centre. Repeat.
Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your pelvis.
Keeping arms straight, raise the kettlebell slightly higher than head level.
Return to the starting position and repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.
Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

shoulders.name: Kettlebell Front Raise
steps: Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your pelvis.
Keeping arms straight, raise the kettlebell slightly higher than head level.
Return to the starting position and repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.
Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

shoulders.name: Kettlebell Rear Delt Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.
Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

shoulders.name: Kettlebell Long Lever Lateral Raise
steps: Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

shoulders.name: Band Pull Apart
steps: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you.
Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.
Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.
Anchor the band at eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Use an overhand grip with both hands. Pull the band to the bridge of your nose flaring your elbows out.
Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side.
The band should scrape against your shirt.

shoulders.name: Band Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.
Anchor the band at eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Use an overhand grip with both hands. Pull the band to the bridge of your nose flaring your elbows out.
Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side.
The band should scrape against your shirt.

shoulders.name: Band Face Pull
steps: Anchor the band at eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Use an overhand grip with both hands. Pull the band to the bridge of your nose flaring your elbows out.
Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side.
The band should scrape against your shirt.

shoulders.name: Band Lateral Raise
steps: Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side.
The band should scrape against your shirt.

shoulders.name: Cable Overhead Press
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine. Stand upright making sure to maintain a flat back. Your starting position will have your palms facing forward.
Use both your elbows and shoulders to press the weight directly overhead.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arm straight out to the side.
Raise until your arm is parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.
Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top.
Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm.
From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

shoulders.name: Cable Lateral Raise
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arm straight out to the side.
Raise until your arm is parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.
Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top.
Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm.
From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

shoulders.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
steps: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top.
Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm.
From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.
Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

shoulders.name: Cable Upright Row
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

chest.name: Dips
steps: Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment
Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows
Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.
Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders.
Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body
Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body
Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform.
Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench.
Push body up until arms are extended.
Use a bench to elevate your feet.
Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground
Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

chest.name: Push Up
steps: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders.
Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body
Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body
Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform.
Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench.
Push body up until arms are extended.
Use a bench to elevate your feet.
Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground
Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

chest.name: Incline Push Up
steps: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform.
Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench.
Push body up until arms are extended.
Use a bench to elevate your feet.
Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground
Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

chest.name: Decline Push Up
steps: Use a bench to elevate your feet.
Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground
Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

chest.name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Raise the bench to a 30 - 45 degree angle
Lay on the bench and set your feet on the ground.
Raise the dumbbells with straight arms then slowly lower them to about shoulder width.
Raise them again until your arms are locked and at the starting position again.
Lay flat on the bench and place your feet on the ground.
Begin the exercise with the dumbbells held together above your chest, elbows slightly bent.
Simultaneously lower the weights to either side.
Pause when the weights are parallel to the bench, then raise your arms to the starting position.
Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.
Start by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing forward.
Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.

chest.name: Dumbbell Incline Chest Flys
steps: Lay flat on the bench and place your feet on the ground.
Begin the exercise with the dumbbells held together above your chest, elbows slightly bent.
Simultaneously lower the weights to either side.
Pause when the weights are parallel to the bench, then raise your arms to the starting position.
Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.
Start by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing forward.
Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.

chest.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.
Start by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing forward.
Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.

chest.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
steps: Start by lying flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells at chest level with your palms facing forward.
Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.

chest.name: Barbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.
Lower the bar to your mid chest
Raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.
Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees.
Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.
Lower the bar to your mid chest
Raise the bar (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.
Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.
Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.
Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

chest.name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees.
Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.
Lower the bar to your mid chest
Raise the bar (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.
Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.
Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.
Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

chest.name: Barbell Floor Press
steps: Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.
Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.
Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

chest.name: Barbell Hooklying Bench Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

chest.name: Chest Stretch Variation One
steps: Using a raised wall, place your arm at a 90 degree angle against it.
With a staggered stance, lean into the wall extending your chest.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position and repeat on opposite side.
Lay on your side with one hand just in front of you.
With a slight bend in your arm, rotate your arm around your body as slowly as possible.
Return to the starting position and then repeat on the other side.
Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together.
Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you.
Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position.
Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.
Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

chest.name: Chest Stretch Variation Two
steps: Lay on your side with one hand just in front of you.
With a slight bend in your arm, rotate your arm around your body as slowly as possible.
Return to the starting position and then repeat on the other side.
Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together.
Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you.
Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position.
Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.
Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

chest.name: Chest Stretch Variation Three
steps: Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together.
Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you.
Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position.
Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.
Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

chest.name: Chest Stretch Variation Four
steps: Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.
Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

chest.name: Kettlebell Chest Press
steps: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, hold the kettlebell at your chest with both hands.
Fully extend your arms, raising the kettlebell until your elbows are locked.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.
Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, leave one arm resting to the side of the body.
Using the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length directly upwards of your shoulder.
Lower your arm until your upper arm to elbow is resting on the floor.
Return to starting position.
Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body.
Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.
Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.
Repeat.

chest.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Press
steps: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, leave one arm resting to the side of the body.
Using the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length directly upwards of your shoulder.
Lower your arm until your upper arm to elbow is resting on the floor.
Return to starting position.
Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body.
Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.
Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.
Repeat.

chest.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Chest Fly
steps: Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body.
Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.
Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.
Repeat.

chest.name: Kettlebell Walkover Pushup
steps: Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.
Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.
Repeat.

chest.name: Band Single Arm Chest Press
steps: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and elbow across your body until your arm is fully extended.
Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger.
This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level.
Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position.
Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs.
Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.
Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.
Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

chest.name: Band Pushup
steps: Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger.
This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level.
Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position.
Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs.
Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.
Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.
Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

chest.name: Band Single Arm Pec Fly
steps: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs.
Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.
Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.
Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

chest.name: Band Chest Fly
steps: Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.
Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.
Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

chest.name: Cable Chest Press
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cables should be set to shoulder height.
Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.
Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward.
From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.
Use a handle attachment set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.
Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

chest.name: Cable Pec Fly
steps: Use a handle attachment set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.
Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

biceps.name: Chin Ups
steps: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you)
With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar.
Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

biceps.name: Dumbbell Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.
Raise one dumbbell and twist your forearm until it is vertical and your palm faces the shoulder.
Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm
Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling).
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.
Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.
Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.
Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
steps: Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling).
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.
Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.
Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.
Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
steps: Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.
Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.
Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Dumbbell Incline Hammer Curl
steps: Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Barbell Curl
steps: While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly bring the weight back down to the starting position.
Take a double overhand grip that's about shoulder width. Flex your elbows while keeping your elbows tucked in. Try not to let them flare out.
Curl until your forearm presses into your bicep. Then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

biceps.name: Barbell Reverse Curl
steps: Take a double overhand grip that's about shoulder width. Flex your elbows while keeping your elbows tucked in. Try not to let them flare out.
Curl until your forearm presses into your bicep. Then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

biceps.name: Barbell Landmine Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.
Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

biceps.name: Barbell Long Landmine Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

biceps.name: Biceps Stretch Variation One
steps: Stand one foot in front of the other with the wall to your right, an arms width away.
Place your hand on the wall, fingers pointing away from you.
Gently lean forward, keeping your hand stationary.
Repeat with the other arm.
Stand facing the wall, an arm's width away.
Place your hand on the wall with your fingers pointing down.
Lean slightly into the wall to feel the stretch in your bicep.
Bend your arm at the elbow, raising your hand to your shoulder.
Using your other hand, stretch the arm down to its full extent.
Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

biceps.name: Biceps Stretch Variation Two
steps: Stand facing the wall, an arm's width away.
Place your hand on the wall with your fingers pointing down.
Lean slightly into the wall to feel the stretch in your bicep.
Bend your arm at the elbow, raising your hand to your shoulder.
Using your other hand, stretch the arm down to its full extent.
Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

biceps.name: Biceps Stretch Variation Three
steps: Bend your arm at the elbow, raising your hand to your shoulder.
Using your other hand, stretch the arm down to its full extent.
Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

biceps.name: Biceps Stretch Variation Four
steps: Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

biceps.name: Kettlebell Goblet Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis.
Raise the kettlebell bending your arms at the elbow until the kettlebell is level with your chest.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.
Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand with your forearm facing out.
Raise the kettlebell, bending your arm at the elbow and keeping your forearm vertical until your palm faces the shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.
Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.
Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand with your forearm facing out.
Raise the kettlebell, bending your arm at the elbow and keeping your forearm vertical until your palm faces the shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.
Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.
Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Kettlebell Preacher Curl
steps: Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.
Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Kettlebell Concentration Curl
steps: Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

biceps.name: Band Bayesian Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. Point your palms straight forward.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.
Attach band to a low anchor point. Use a neutral grip.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.
Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position.
The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out.
And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position.
Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

biceps.name: Band Bayesian Hammer Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. Use a neutral grip.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.
Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position.
The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out.
And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position.
Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

biceps.name: Band Kneeling Single Arm Pulldown
steps: Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position.
The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out.
And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position.
Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

biceps.name: Band Bayesian Reverse Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

biceps.name: Cable Bayesian Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine.
Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Use a neutral grip thumb facing up pinky-facing down). Flex at the elbow and extend.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Start with a neutral grip. Flex at the elbow. While flexing twist your palm. When you hit the top of the movement your palm should be facing upward.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

biceps.name: Cable Hammer Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Use a neutral grip thumb facing up pinky-facing down). Flex at the elbow and extend.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Start with a neutral grip. Flex at the elbow. While flexing twist your palm. When you hit the top of the movement your palm should be facing upward.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

biceps.name: Cable Twisting Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Start with a neutral grip. Flex at the elbow. While flexing twist your palm. When you hit the top of the movement your palm should be facing upward.
Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

biceps.name: Cable Reverse Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

triceps.name: Dips
steps: Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment
Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows
Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.
Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape
Use a standard push up position
Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body
Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.
Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight.
Lower your body straight down.
Slowly press back up to the starting point.
TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.
Hold your body at arms length above the equipment
Inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Keep your elbows close to your body and your torso upright.
Exhale, and using your triceps raise your body back to the starting position.

triceps.name: Diamond Push Ups
steps: Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape
Use a standard push up position
Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body
Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.
Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight.
Lower your body straight down.
Slowly press back up to the starting point.
TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.
Hold your body at arms length above the equipment
Inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Keep your elbows close to your body and your torso upright.
Exhale, and using your triceps raise your body back to the starting position.

triceps.name: Bench Dips
steps: Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight.
Lower your body straight down.
Slowly press back up to the starting point.
TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.
Hold your body at arms length above the equipment
Inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Keep your elbows close to your body and your torso upright.
Exhale, and using your triceps raise your body back to the starting position.

triceps.name: Dips narrow elbows
steps: Hold your body at arms length above the equipment
Inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Keep your elbows close to your body and your torso upright.
Exhale, and using your triceps raise your body back to the starting position.

triceps.name: Dumbbell Skullcrusher
steps: Lay flat on the floor or a bench with your fists extended to the ceiling and a neutral grip.
Break at the elbows until your fists are by your temples. Then extend your elbows and flex your triceps at the top.
Sit on the bench and hold a dumbbell with both hands. Raise the dumbbell overhead at arms length, holding the weight up with the palms of your hands.
Keep your elbows in while you lower the weight behind your head, your upper arms stationary.
Raise the weight back to starting position.
Start by lying on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells above your chest with your arms extended and your palms facing each other. This is the starting position.
Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your forehead by bending your elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.
Once the dumbbells are close to your forehead, reverse the motion by extending your elbows and returning to the starting position.
Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling.
Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps, then flex at the shoulder joint bringing your upper arms to the sides of your head.
